result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Misdemeanor Batter [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with AML unless approved by the court.
No contact with firearms,

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments, and surcharges, including  the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
Court set restitution at zero.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Timothy Termaine Bentley.  Attorney Mallory Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report received and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith, with credit for 11 DAYS time served. Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
signed and filed.
filed.
Probation review memo dated 10/11/22, filed.

Defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Timothy Termaine Bentley.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/ Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 and 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Counts 1, 4, and 5: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to counts 4 and 5, with credit for 0 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.

As to Count 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 204 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 5, but consecutive to count 1, with credit for 204 days served. 
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

As to Count 5: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 4, but consecutive to count 1, with credit for 90 days served. 
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to Count 1: Serve 30 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with AML unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 08/29/2022.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests to be heard on bail at next court date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Timothy Termaine Bentley in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
